item.description:
From Cheryl at The Coolidge Corner Theatre:

This is an advance screening of a controversial documentary produced by Red Sox Manager Bobby Valentine. He will be present to introduce the film and take questions.

For 16 year old baseball players, or peloteros, in the Dominican Republic, the only real chance to escape real poverty comes every July 2nd, the day they become eligible to sign with a major league team. The film follows two young players as they confront fierce competition and frequent corruption in the months leading to the most important day of their lives.

Tickets are $9.75 or $6.75 for Coolidge Corner members. www.coolidge.org or at the box office.

See Tuesday Boston Globe front page for feature article.

Opens Friday July 13.

There is No Event Host for this meetup! Any attending RSVPs should E Mail each other to meeet.
item.name: Sneak preview: Ballplayer: Pelotero with Intro and Q & A with Bobby Valentine
